profile.name: Oscar
profile.title: Software Developer
profile.description:
Hello! I‚Äôm Oscar Sanchez and since I was a little I loved technology, play with it, see how it works and I was fascinated about developers and hackers so meanwhile I was study I was reading, watching and trying stuff from internet.
Now i have created web apps, APIs, small client apps, a lot of PoCs! And hacked a few things ;)
So what‚Äôs next ? a challenge!? Yeah for sure! 

Experienced Software Engineer, skilled in technology, ethical-hacking and C#. Strong engineering professional with a full-stack background and a lot of stories to tell about technology!

challenges.description:
My passion to deliver beautiful digital products drove me to CloudDistrict, in order to help local businesses conceptualize and build their digital product. 

We successfully set up an AWS scalable solution to process and serve invoices for 5M users, using NodeJS (Lambdas), PostgreSQL, and AWS API Gateway.

Leading projects as a team tech leader, focusing the team on delivering value to the clients.

Standardize internal working workflows.

I wanted to settle up for a while and my gym was looking for a personal development to improve repetitive tasks with software solutions.

Taking the ownership of the entire development and making decisions based on the needs was the challenge I was looking for üòÅ.
Traveling around in Italy I felt in love with Venice and Work in a Hostel where I learn a lot of human Relationships and empathy.
We developed Mobile apps for local business in Ireland, taking requirements from clients and delivering beautiful apps.

A Hackathon for a 4 weeks in California!? Yeah! i'm totally in! I was in the March piscine where you have your teammates, your computer and a lot of hours to do all the intense and infinite exercises in C that 42 throw it to you. 
Teamwork, fun and loves to technology needed =)

What about to try to create a Startup in just 48 hours? Keep saying, try! and enjoy failing! Thats Startup Weekend about and its definitely its a life experience everyone should give a try, it doesnt matter who you are the important part is your opinnion its different and thats the key!

After trying in March 2017 i decited to help in the making of and was huge fun! Working with the SW Team and trying to make the event posible was amazing experience.

2013 - 2016: Faast
We develop a Software as a Service (SaaS) of 24x7 Pentesting Service to detect threats before attackers do.
I was implementing OSINT plugins and hacking techniques using C#.
Learning the bases of design patterns and dealing with MongoDB.


2016 - 2018: SealSign
A biometric solution to securely sign documents.
I was refactoring the style as a FrontEnd developer in ASP.Net and worked as a DevOps with Jenkins-Vagrant to automate all deployments and tasks
